title: Lewis helps Gratz beat Central
text:
Lewis finished with 103 yards and a touchdown on 15 carries in the Public League AAAA Liberty division contest. He also added three catches for 99 yards and another touchdown. 
Gratz (6-2, 6-0) sits comfortably atop the division after knocking off the second-place Lancers (4-4, 4-2). 
"It was important," Lewis said. "They're in our division. They were in second place and we were in first. We had a lot of people not playing so we knew this game was important and we had to put them away." 
Injuries and academic issues sidelined a few players for Gratz. The result was a disjointed performance fraught with sloppy play and turnovers by both teams. 
Central lost all three of its fumbles in the second quarter. Gratz finished the game with a pair of fumbles. 
Despite the miscues, Lewis remained focused. His 55-yard receiving touchdown in the third quarter came after sophomore quarterback Amir Gillis first dropped the snap. 
Gillis scooped the ball, scrambled left and hit a wide open Lewis, who blazed down the left sideline this time with both size-11s on his feet. 
"I just couldn't give up on plays," Lewis said. "I just had to keep my mind in it because I knew how important this game was." 
Simon Gratz 7 21 6 0 - 34 
Central 0 0 0 6 - 6 
G: Luke White 22 pass from Amir Gillis (Amir Gillis kick) 
G: Kenneth Bennett 27 pass from Gillis (Gillis kick) 
G: Amir Lewis 27 run (Gillis kick) 
G: White 28 run (Gillis kick) 
G Lewis 55 pass from Gillis (kick failed) 
C: Blake Schwartz 4 run (kick failed)
